title: arhipova
author: arhipova
content: Let us discuss on this thread about the crypto apps that you find most easy to use. Based on my personal experience, for international use, binance has the most user friendly apps . There are lot of features on this app that are useful to users like one can convert one coin to another with single click without any charges.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Only Binance is the one that I've used that has an app. Because usually when I trade with other exchanges, I use their desktop versions when I test them. So, when I'm committed or likely to stay on one exchange that's when I try to use anything that's about them like their app version but just as you, it's always Binance for me.Quote from: arhipova on November 02, 2023, 03:37:36 PMThere are lot of features on this app that are useful to users like one can convert one coin to another with single click without any charges. I'd assume the others are also the same like this or if they have a fee, they're just minimal.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: There are many exchanges are easy to use e.g. Blockdx, Agoradesk, etc where you only need to create an account and ready to trade without KYC bullshit which could take a hour or day(s) to trade. There's also a chance they might freeze your funds whenever they want and it will take more times, again.

comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: IMO Binance is the most crypto-friendly including doing cashouts to my local currency without fees so I have stuck to it for some years already. Regarding the other features, I believe Binance also has the best to offer. Since it is the biggest crypto exchange in the world it has an enormous budget to innovate and not be left behind by its competitors. The good thing about Binance is it continues to work in getting more permits from many countries around the world and hopefully, my government will be one of them in the near future.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I have not used any application before due to the difficulty of hiding your data compared to the web versions, as in the past it was possible to use Binance OKX without any problems with any VPN, but downloading an application means access to more permissions such as mic, phone and photos. This is a lot of data for international exchange.Quote from: Solosanz on November 04, 2023, 09:41:26 AMThere are many exchanges are easy to use e.g. Blockdx, Agoradesk, etc where you only need to create an account and ready to trade without KYC bullshit which could take a hour or day(s) to trade. There's also a chance they might freeze your funds whenever they want and it will take more times, again.this is totally off-topic, What @OP wants is users' experience with the APP wallet, not nonKYC bullshit, and Blockdx does not have a mobile app.

comments.author: yudi09
comments.body: Quote from: arhipova on November 02, 2023, 03:37:36 PMLet us discuss on this thread about the crypto apps that you find most easy to use. Based on my personal experience, for international use, binance has the most user friendly apps . There are lot of features on this app that are useful to users like one can convert one coin to another with single click without any charges. International usage experience, binance is the easiest for me to use. Apart from Binance Exchange, I also use local exchanges for trading. The local exchange that I like the most is tokocrypto. There are many local exchange options available and registered under government regulations because my country only allows crypto as a commodity asset, but the exchanges I mentioned have the ease of use that I feel.Both require users to complete KYC to be able to trade.Tokocrypto makes it easy because it provides IDR pairs. If Binance doesn't have a BTC/IDR pair, it only provides a BTC/BIDR pair.

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: Are you talking about apps on your mobile phone or just on the website? The majority of the applications that are on the market now are quite easy to use and the factors for me are the markets that the exchange has or what coin it has—something to that sense. Having fees and easy to use are quite different things to compare. One app could have the easiest interface but have a fee. The other one, you could have no fee but it's complicated to trade. I think I would choose the easier interface. Anyway, have you decided aside from Binance OP?

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: Quote from: arhipova on November 02, 2023, 03:37:36 PMLet us discuss on this thread about the crypto apps that you find most easy to use. Based on my personal experience, for international use, binance has the most user friendly apps . There are lot of features on this app that are useful to users like one can convert one coin to another with single click without any charges. I find Bybit more easy to use rather than Binance app due to its much easier to understand functions. Binance turns out to become more complex after their addition of bunch of trading tools that is already complex for users. The P2P on Bybit have zero fee promo and provides much better rate on my currency that’s why I preferred this app since I feel convenience on bybit compared to binance. Plus the fact that Binance is consistently being target by US government makes me hesitate to use it more often. The nightmare leave by FTX makes me automatically avoid any exchanges that has conflict.

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: arhipova on November 02, 2023, 03:37:36 PM-snip-There are lot of features on this app that are useful to users like one can convert one coin to another with single click without any charges. Zero fee is a specific policy, user display and features are development matters. They are not related at all, I think your expectations rarely come true.I heard that Mexc still has a zero fee trading offer. I don't use this exchange, so I don't have any experience to share. I used to use the Kucoin app, if I remember correctly they allow withdrawals without 2FA confirmation.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Quote from: arhipova on November 02, 2023, 03:37:36 PMLet us discuss on this thread about the crypto apps that you find most easy to use. Based on my personal experience, for international use, binance has the most user friendly apps . There are lot of features on this app that are useful to users like one can convert one coin to another with single click without any charges. Binance and Kucoin support the trading of crypto to fiat through P2P trade and that's the main reason I trade with them. I've used the mobile version as well as the web version and the experience is not bad. The Binance and Kucoin mobile apps are easy to use and both have cool features like bot trading but I find the design of the Kucoin app more attractive. Though I had to discontinue trading with Kucoin following the introduction of compulsory KYC.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on November 04, 2023, 10:40:52 AMthis is totally off-topic, What @OP wants is users' experience with the APP wallet, not nonKYC bullshit, and Blockdx does not have a mobile app.The @OP didn't mention mobile app, he only mention app which is run in PC or laptop is still appropriate.Actually the users' experience using those both exchanges are friendly to use especially @OP only talk about buy, sell and convert here.If he mention mobile app, high liquidity, leverage/futures, and any other features that only have by CEX, it's when my reply is off topic.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: To be honest, most exchanges apps that I have used are super easy to use and figure out how they works, especially binance and kucoin apps. Even new users can use them to trade or exchange coins without any problems.The only problem I had with binance app for mobile is it's high consumption of data and other resources. I always get a notification from my phone alerting me the binance app is consuming a lot of power even when running on the background.

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Most crypto exchange mobile apps are actually easy to use. I tried different exchange apps before and currently use kucoin and binance. So far, the only thing that is concerning is the consumption of storage data like what mentioned above, with minutes of use it will take up to hundreds of MB, you can check it on the app's cache.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on November 05, 2023, 10:57:39 PMMost crypto exchange mobile apps are actually easy to use. I tried different exchange apps before and currently use kucoin and binance. So far, the only thing that is concerning is the consumption of storage data like what mentioned above, with minutes of use it will take up to hundreds of MB, you can check it on the app's cache.I agree, most of the apps that has been made by these exchanges are compatible mostly with even old smartphones. And it's true that they're consuming that much or it's just that I usually install them to test out on my old phone.Anyway, I understand that because they need to maintain what's in the app through continuous updates and upgrades. @OP if you want no charges, only a few of them do that but are those centavos of charge per trade do hurt you?

comments.author: bayu7adi
comments.body: I think if there's something more comfortable than Binance, could you please provide a comparison of that app with Binance? When it comes to centralized exchanges, Binance truly dominates. Even the user interface for trading is very beginner-friendly. Binance's mobile app is suitable for all users, from beginners to expert traders.Binance's current reputation is very convincing for many crypto users, and the amount of assets entrusted to Binance is also very high.I use a local exchange app called Tokocrypto, which is also connected to Binance. Tokocrypto, up to now, has proven to be easier for me to use when buying and selling BTC for FIAT especially IDR.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Well, if we are talking about exchange app with the maximum features that is the most easiest to use, I did chose binance, I like the Binance app so much as it makes everything about crypto transactions very easy and fast.When we talk about the best apps that is user friendly and easy to get around on, removing features as a criteria, then I will say that amongst all I've used, including binance, it's remitano app for me, this app is very easy to get around on, easy to understand and so on, but the downside is that they don't have alot of coins listed, and as well, the app doesn't have alot of features to play around with.Now, coming to decentralized exchange apps, with a lot of features that is unlike a dex, amongst all that I have used, chainge.finance is the best for me, the chainge.finance app is an all + extra in one when it comes to everything crypto and decentralization, there is the spot dex, futures dex, margin dex, visual visa card, hardware wallet, so many features all packed in one app.

comments.author: Antotena
comments.body: Quote from: inthelongrun on November 04, 2023, 10:09:58 AMIMO Binance is the most crypto-friendly including doing cashouts to my local currency without fees so I have stuck to it for some years already. Regarding the other features, I believe Binance also has the best to offer. Since it is the biggest crypto exchange in the world it has an enormous budget to innovate and not be left behind by its competitors. The good thing about Binance is it continues to work in getting more permits from many countries around the world and hopefully, my government will be one of them in the near future.Binance is great because they know very well how to market their company but I find it challenging why you need a minimum of $10 to be able to.make trade, I know they are doing it to get more liquidity but they should consider we that are having turndown in economy especially the high rate of dollars, you can't trade  anything less than that amount than $10 which is equivalent to ₦10,200. It's exactly 33% of minimum wage here.Binance is great but I like kucoin, even if not for everything I prefer to see others give me what I want with the amount I have. kucoin is one of the best exchange I will pick before anyone. The rest have the same quality or even better than kucoin but I love kucoin as an exchange than Binance that is meant to big men that wouldn't care less about what is happening in crypto.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: Antotena on November 16, 2023, 08:51:37 PMI know they are doing it to get more liquidity but they should consider we that are having turndown in economy especially the high rate of dollars, you can't trade  anything less than that amount than $10 which is equivalent to ₦10,200. It's exactly 33% of minimum wage here.I think they apply that limit to filter out bots and spammers. Not to mention it will also save them a lot of money from making multiple small transactions. I don't think they will change it based on the minimum wage of each region, so your best bet is just to use other exchanges if that is a problem for you. While their app runs well, it should not be your priority if liquidity is your main issue.
